35.70.text:
Hi everyone and good morning. My name is Emine
Ulucay first of all I want to thank the whole

42.02.text:
Morning Talks team for inviting me over for
this talk. Well I will be talking about how

49.50.text:
to feed your body and feed your soul and hopefully
to be able to shine inside out so to be happy.

58.49.text:
Some of you know me already, there are people
that don’t know me and I think there might

65.26.text:
be people looking at me thinking ‘ what
on earth can this 20 year old girl have achieved

71.97.text:
to give this talk today?’ Firstly I have
to reassure you that I am unfortunately much

76.80.text:
older than 20 and I don’t really know what
I have achieved to be honest but since we

84.05.text:
are all here I’ll try to make it as interesting
as I can so its worth for all of us.

90.26.text:
So I want to start with a bit of background.
I graduated from Human nutrition and Dietetics

101.14.text:
about three years ago from the London Metropolitan
University. Now since then I have been working

112.40.text:
in Healthcare, so what I basically do is help
people lose weight or gain weight but its

118.18.text:
not limited with that because what we usually
do is, we help those with chronic illnesses

123.70.text:
such as diabetes and cardiac stuff to learn
how to eat. So at the moment I currently have

133.83.text:
two part time jobs one of them is in a private
hospital in Nicosia in the North side and

140.16.text:
the other one is all around North Cyprus where
we teach young basketball players about health

147.57.text:
and nutrition as part of an E.U. funded project
which is a join program by the Turkish diabetes

154.74.text:
association and Peace Players International
Cyprus and apart from that I also work for

163.93.text:
a private catering company where we write
a monthly menu for the government jail. Apart

175.81.text:
from my money making activities I also train
for triathlon. For those of you who don’t

182.78.text:
know what a triathlon is, it’s a sport where
you swim, bike and run. What people ask me

194.61.text:
often is do they all happen on the same day?
Yes they do and a matter of fact the transition

203.14.text:
from cycling to swimming is a competition
by it self because you can actually lose or

209.98.text:
win the race when you transit from one to
another so when you get out of the water you

217.81.text:
have to unzip your swim suit while you run
taking of your cap and goggles to change to

223.22.text:
your cycling gear. This is a small quote that
I really like it says that a triathlete is

232.24.text:
a person that doesn’t understand that one
sport is enough and I think this is very true

240.09.text:
because once you do a triathlon nothing really
satisfies you, sometimes when I run or swim

247.87.text:
I don’t gat the same satisfaction and feeling
I get when I do a triathlon. I’m juggling

257.84.text:
2 part time jobs and a contract job and triathlon
I also make time to work on the theCyprea.com

266.92.text:
which is a lifestyle blog, I co-founded it
with a very good friend of mine who is now

271.14.text:
living in Istanbul and is now also a dietician
Ayse.

277.05.text:
Well the idea to start the blog had been there
for a long time but it wasn’t really kicked

282.34.text:
of until a lot of friends really encouraged
us to do so because we were going on about

287.99.text:
it for a very long time so they were very
bored at the end and they said just do it

293.35.text:
.
From the beginning we had this motto “ Shine

299.76.text:
from inside out “ which is how this talk
came through actually and we honestly think

309.47.text:
as both me and Ayse that to be able to be
happy inside and out, yes its very important

318.85.text:
to eat healthy have a balanced and healthy
diet but is also at least as important to

329.60.text:
make the time to spend on those things that
you really like doing and are passionate about

336.34.text:
and this might be different for everybody
else.

341.79.text:
For us the main aim was to inspire others
to inspire those people who log onto our Instagram

351.17.text:
account or Facebook or randomly just bumping
on our website online to inspire them to live

357.06.text:
healthily and by showing them that they can
actually do this by giving real life examples

364.87.text:
so what we usually do on our Instagram account
is we post daily breakfast photos and usually

377.44.text:
its healthy stuff. So it’s a way to inspire
those who see it or at least try to move on

388.31.text:
from what they eat usually which might be
something a bit less healthy to a healthier

394.84.text:
version of what they might have seen.
As I said because being healthy is not just

401.81.text:
eating healthy we also among sharing the healthy
recipes on the blog we also share some outfit

412.84.text:
photos which the guys are not really interested
in but its more like a girls thing . we also

418.79.text:
share thoughts and suggestions for places
like bars and restaurants and cafes we visit

427.66.text:
and like to the places we travel to for example
we went to Uludag a couple of months ago and

436.87.text:
we spent quite a lot of time devising an Uludag
guide, by the way Uludag is a mountain city

444.90.text:
in Turkey where people sky. It was my first
time and I sucked big time but its ok ill

450.11.text:
be better next time. So now we have a guide
on the blog so if you ever wanted to go to

456.46.text:
Uludag the guide can actually take you from
A. your house to B. Uludag and all the way

462.13.text:
back because you can read about what you can
wear, how much we paid for the tickets for

472.70.text:
transportation and everything so we are trying
to show that its really not that hard to travel.

481.77.text:
We were seven girls we never got lost nobody
lost anything nobody broke a leg so I think

488.61.text:
it was ok. From the scientific side of things,
going back to eating because that’s what

494.54.text:
I talk about in my daily life, we now know
because science tells us that overweight and

502.00.text:
obesity are mainly linked to emotional eating
as genetic and metabolic disorders. What I

512.34.text:
see in my own patients at clinics and as my
other colleagues tell me most dieters they

521.37.text:
know what to do , they know that they souldnt
be eating as much cake, biscuits or crisps

528.61.text:
and they are perfectly aware that the y shouldn’t
be drinking as much alcohol or Coke but they

535.28.text: cannot do it, they fail does anyone know why? Stress. Yes stress is one of the reasons,

550.98.text:
as I said emotion drives a lot of stuff within
us and unfortunately that kind of eating is

561.76.text:
not driven by hunger physical hunger or greediness
as most of us think. Most of us perceive obese

571.14.text:
people to be greedy but I think they are not,
science tells us they are not so what everyone

580.16.text:
does even if they don’t admit it is try
to fill the emotional gap within us with food,

588.69.text:
by pushing that food down our throats we thing
that we are going to fill that gap, but the

594.28.text:
truth is we cant. We will never be able to
fill that gap with food we will only make

601.85.text:
it bigger deeper and hollower because by eating
the more wright we gain we will be unhappier

611.47.text:
and that will probably be followed by social
isolation and everything will be opposite

617.65.text:
of everything we want it to be so this is
again what we are trying to emphasize through

625.56.text:
the blog that is not just healthy eating that
we should be focusing on, you should make

631.38.text:
time to do the things you are really passionate
about because it is vital for your happiness

637.58.text:
and for a slimmer waste line in the end.
Its not always very easy because when we started

652.87.text:
the blog I was working full time and that
was 9 to 6 week days and 9 to 2 on Saturdays

661.49.text:
training at least an hour and a half every
day sometimes twice a day so there were days

668.23.text:
where I would wake up at 6a.m. and with the
help of my boyfriend go and take some photoshoots

675.65.text:
before I could change and go to work or I
would do the same thing with my friend at

683.19.text:
the evening before I got to training or when
I got home o take some recipe pictures before

691.66.text:
I got on the bike and make it to the bike
session so its not always wasy but I think

697.83.text:
when you want to do something you make the
time for it if you don’t want it wnough

701.84.text:
you make excuses for it so its very important
to know how much you want something. And again

711.88.text:
it all sound like sparkly and nice but there
are the downsides of it too and when I usually

721.26.text:
tell people about these stuff they go like
“ Emine how do you fit all this in the same

727.49.text:
day ? “ or “ how do you find the energy
to do this ? “ well there is will and when

738.43.text:
there’s will there is a way and the second
is planning and prioritizing because if you

745.79.text:
don’t plan your time or prioritize stuff
there is no way you are going to get things

752.33.text:
done. But as I said there are day where I
feel like everything gets out of control and

765.17.text:
I just want to break down and scream and breakdown
and cry but I think it is also ok because

771.67.text:
days like that I turn to Ayse and I tend to
other people that I know and are there to

780.86.text:
help me and I also think this is an important
brick of success to know our limits and to

790.81.text:
know what we can achieve but also to know
when we need help because people usually miss

800.46.text:
that point because we perceive needing help
or asking for help as a sigh of weakness,

809.52.text:
I actually think it’s a strength because
its knowing what we are capable of and what

815.31.text:
we are not capable of and trying to balance
each one out.

821.12.text:
Going back to the blog and the time constraints
to be honest with you this is probably the

828.81.text:
first time I’m going to voice it to someone
else except Ayse, our biggest problem and

834.67.text:
barrier aside from time was what on earth
would people think of us as two established

843.16.text:
Dieticians when they see us posing for outfit
pictures and well that was a very big issue.

854.79.text:
Its not easy to run a blog when everybody
knows each other and everybody has their own

859.97.text:
perceptions about each other, so we started
of from a point where we were like “ you

866.15.text:
know we are not models its ok if we cant pose,
what we can do is taking pictures from the

872.06.text:
neck down to show the outfits and we leave
the heads out to a point that we can now wrap

880.54.text:
up a photoshoot in just 15 minutes. But of
course this doesn’t really come all naturally

886.97.text:
I still spend a good amount of time staring
at the outfit photos of bloggers that I admire

894.94.text:
trying to find what works and what doesn’t
and for me the trill of all this was to try

904.88.text:
to push myself to do something that I thought
that I couldn’t because I could never think

911.35.text:
that I could be posing in a “model way “ trying
to show some outfits and I am still not 100%

920.51.text:
satisfied of how I look in them or how I position
myself so I want to work hard everyday to

930.48.text:
improve myself . one thing I want to say is
that im not sure of you realize since the

937.99.text:
beginning of the talk I never used labels
such as I’m a dietician or a triathlete

943.94.text:
or im a blogger because I think that the moment
we label ourselves or others as something

953.10.text:
we instantly add expectations to them and
to ourselves as well both willingly and unwillingly.

961.93.text:
In my head it was really hard to work when
I thought of myself as being somebody, a dietician

969.87.text:
lets say because in my mind the tree things
did not overlap because I don’t know anyone

980.00.text:
who has a professional health carrier, who
does hardcore sports and who blogs about lifestyle

990.62.text:
so the easiest thing was to accept myself
as Emine who happens to have chosen dietetics

999.62.text:
as a profession who loves food and feeling
the utter most pain through triathlons and

1008.17.text:
who also is passionate about experiencing,
exploring and traveling and I was very lucky

1018.28.text:
to have this friend who shares this passions
with me except triathlon, to create a platform

1028.50.text:
where we can share what we really like with
other people. And we alongside with our day

1040.92.text:
jobs, it’s important to point out that Ayse
is still working part time and she lives in

1047.10.text:
Istanbul so she spends an average 3 hours
a day traveling so that’s a lot of time

1054.80.text:
gone. We manage all this to create a digital
platform where we can showcase our creativity

1061.77.text:
our productivity and share anything that inspires
us with other people and I think this is very

1070.02.text:
powerful because the social media is there
and it shouldn’t be just Facebook or Instagram

1077.06.text:
that we check or log onto because it’s a
very powerful tool and we should use it to

1084.79.text:
produce stuff and be productive and for the
blog even if its not yet where we want it

1092.31.text:
to be im pretty sure it will be because I
haven’t really had anything in my life yet

1098.13.text:
that I really wanted and I didn’t achieve,
not because I’m talented but because I work

1102.66.text:
very hard, it did make us learn a lot of stuff
for example in less than 9 months I learned

1116.02.text:
how to use a DSLR camera, I can now edit photos
even if im not perfect at it im way better

1125.30.text:
that I was, we have improved our writing skills
and the way we express ourselves and we met

1136.48.text:
a lot of people, I think its one of the most
important things I think everything has a

1143.35.text:
reason it might not be as big as want it to
be yet but its definitely taking us to the

1152.26.text:
place we want to be.
As a triathlete triathlon has taught me a

1162.41.text:
lot of stuff but the main thing is to never
give up because there are times that your

1170.58.text:
feet bleed during a race, sometimes you feel
like dying even from hunger, because a race

1178.40.text:
lasts about six and a half hours and you do
get hungry. You have to keep going no matter

1185.64.text:
how hard the times are and the most important
is to keep going when others give up because

1194.63.text:
only then you have a chance that you might
succeed.

1203.46.text:
The last part is a bit personal to me. Last
week was the first time that I was first at

1212.81.text:
a Turkey race and again the point from this
was that you should dare to dream and dream

1224.28.text:
big because I cant tell you how many times
before the race I have visualized crossing

1231.27.text:
the finish line first, it scared me , even
the thought of it was scary because when you

1236.63.text:
think of it you cant believe that you can
do it and the thought that I couldn’t do

1243.57.text:
it once I believed it freaked me out but I
thought ok just do it, if it works out it

1249.40.text:
works out if it doesn’t you make it work
out so I dreamt about it I visualized it and

1256.68.text:
I did it. So the point I want to make is don’t
think about what others will think of the

1266.99.text:
dreams you dream about because usually they
don’t think that way, its yourself that

1274.21.text:
thinks that other people will see it that
way it’s our perceptions, we have our own

1280.23.text:
values about ourselves in our minds and we
think that other people see us that way too

1286.87.text:
which is usually not, because we are the harshest
on ourselves so just find what inspires you,

1297.58.text:
what really makes you happy what is really
your passion and dream for it, work for it

1304.72.text:
every single day and make it happen. There
will be people that tell you, you cannot do

1310.12.text:
it or there is going to be yourself saying
that you don’t have time, you’re not good

1317.81.text:
enough or anything like that but its not true
because when you want it bad enough and work

1324.60.text:
for it, it is bound to happen.
I want to finish with my favorite quote for

1331.91.text:
the time which got me through the finish line
as well and good afternoon in Russian I don’t

1345.98.text:
know why, but it was these two sentences that
I had in my mind during the race and it is

1353.07.text:
a very powerful quote “ Whether you think
you can or you think you can’t you are right”

1360.52.text:
so it is all in your mind if you think you
can do it you can I you think you can’t

1368.14.text: you can’t. thank you for your time and listening
